resources.string: Hi! I am a translator with ten years of experience specializing in subtitle creation. Having worked with all parts of the process, from timing to translation, I have deep knowledge of the whole system. But my biggest passion has always been the tech field, so I am reinventing myself as a Mobile Developer. I have built this app as a double portfolio to display some titles I have translated .also { this }. ðŸ˜‰

This app was born from my urge to practice what I have learned with training courses since I decided to become a mobile developer. Its purpose is to be a portfolio/business card to display some works I have done professionally and what I have learned to use as a developer."

I have developed the app using JetPack Compose and learned how to use and modify many Composable functions to create a clean and direct style using Material design concepts and resources. The app is also available in Portuguese."

The app Architecture follows the MVVM pattern. A ViewModel manages all fragments and activities. For instance, the data observed by the Detail Screen was built as Stateflow to survive changes in Lifecycle. I divided the Packages into the UI layer and Data Layer."

" All images and information loaded onto the Titles LazyGrid are fed in real-time using Retrofit and built with Coil. Instead of hardcoding the data, I have used Retrofit API and OMDb API. All data is managed asynchronously with coroutines to free the UI."

By leveraging the power of the Room library, I have successfully managed a local SQLite database with ease. With this new functionality, I am able to add and delete titles within my app, making it a comprehensive platform for efficient database management.
